entry.name: align-items
entry.desc: Aligns flex items along the cross axis of the current line of the flex container.

value.name: baseline
value.desc: If the flex item’s inline axis is the same as the cross axis, this value is identical to 'flex-start'. Otherwise, it participates in baseline alignment.

value.name: center
value.desc: The flex item’s margin box is centered in the cross axis within the line.

value.name: flex-end
value.desc: The cross-end margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-end edge of the line.

value.name: flex-start
value.desc: The cross-start margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-start edge of the line.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: If the cross size property of the flex item computes to auto, and neither of the cross-axis margins are auto, the flex item is stretched.

entry.name: align-self
entry.desc: Allows the default alignment along the cross axis to be overridden for individual flex items.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Computes to the value of 'align-items' on the element’s parent, or 'stretch' if the element has no parent. On absolutely positioned elements, it computes to itself.

value.name: baseline
value.desc: If the flex item’s inline axis is the same as the cross axis, this value is identical to 'flex-start'. Otherwise, it participates in baseline alignment.

value.name: center
value.desc: The flex item’s margin box is centered in the cross axis within the line.

value.name: flex-end
value.desc: The cross-end margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-end edge of the line.

value.name: flex-start
value.desc: The cross-start margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-start edge of the line.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: If the cross size property of the flex item computes to auto, and neither of the cross-axis margins are auto, the flex item is stretched.

entry.name: backface-visibility
entry.desc: Determines whether or not the 'back' side of a transformed element is visible when facing the viewer. With an identity transform, the front side of an element faces the viewer.

value.name: hidden
value.desc: Back side is hidden.

value.name: visible
value.desc: Back side is visible.

entry.name: background-color
entry.desc: Sets the background color of an element.

entry.name: border-bottom-color
entry.desc: Sets the color of the bottom border.

entry.name: border-bottom-left-radius
entry.desc: Defines the radii of the bottom left outer border edge.

entry.name: border-bottom-right-radius
entry.desc: Defines the radii of the bottom right outer border edge.

entry.name: border-bottom-width
entry.desc: Sets the thickness of the bottom border.

entry.name: border-color
entry.desc: The color of the border around all four edges of an element.

value.name: logical
value.desc: Indicates that the values map to the logical properties instead of the physical ones.

entry.name: border-left-color
entry.desc: Sets the color of the left border.

entry.name: border-left-width
entry.desc: Sets the thickness of the left border.

entry.name: border-radius
entry.desc: Defines the radii of the outer border edge.

entry.name: border-right-color
entry.desc: Sets the color of the right border.

entry.name: border-right-width
entry.desc: Sets the thickness of the right border.

entry.name: border-style
entry.desc: The style of the border around edges of an element.

value.name: logical
value.desc: Indicates that the values map to the logical properties instead of the physical ones.

entry.name: border-top-color
entry.desc: Sets the color of the top border.

entry.name: border-top-left-radius
entry.desc: Defines the radii of the top left outer border edge.

entry.name: border-top-right-radius
entry.desc: Defines the radii of the top right outer border edge.

entry.name: border-top-width
entry.desc: Sets the thickness of the top border.

entry.name: border-width
entry.desc: Shorthand that sets the four 'border-*-width' properties. If it has four values, they set top, right, bottom and left in that order. If left is missing, it is the same as right; if bottom is missing, it is the same as top; if right is missing, it is the same as top.

value.name: logical
value.desc: Indicates that the values map to the logical properties instead of the physical ones.

entry.name: bottom
entry.desc: Specifies how far an absolutely positioned box's bottom margin edge is offset above the bottom edge of the box's 'containing block'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well

entry.name: color
entry.desc: Color of an element's text

entry.name: flex
entry.desc: Specifies the components of a flexible length: the flex grow factor and flex shrink factor, and the flex basis.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Retrieves the value of the main size property as the used 'flex-basis'.

value.name: none
value.desc: Expands to '0 0 auto'.

entry.name: flex-basis
entry.desc: Sets the flex basis.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Retrieves the value of the main size property as the used 'flex-basis'.

entry.name: flex-direction
entry.desc: Specifies how flex items are placed in the flex container, by setting the direction of the flex container’s main axis.

value.name: column
value.desc: The flex container’s main axis has the same orientation as the block axis of the current writing mode.

value.name: column-reverse
value.desc: Same as 'column', except the main-start and main-end directions are swapped.

value.name: row
value.desc: The flex container’s main axis has the same orientation as the inline axis of the current writing mode.

value.name: row-reverse
value.desc: Same as 'row', except the main-start and main-end directions are swapped.

entry.name: flex-grow
entry.desc: Sets the flex grow factor. Negative numbers are invalid.

entry.name: flex-shrink
entry.desc: Sets the flex shrink factor. Negative numbers are invalid.

entry.name: flex-wrap
entry.desc: Controls whether the flex container is single-line or multi-line, and the direction of the cross-axis, which determines the direction new lines are stacked in.

value.name: nowrap
value.desc: The flex container is single-line.

value.name: wrap
value.desc: The flexbox is multi-line.

value.name: wrap-reverse
value.desc: Same as 'wrap', except the cross-start and cross-end directions are swapped.

entry.name: font-family
entry.desc: Specifies a prioritized list of font family names or generic family names. A user agent iterates through the list of family names until it matches an available font that contains a glyph for the character to be rendered.

value.name: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif
Cambria, Cochin, Georgia, Times, 'Times New Roman', serif
'Gill Sans', 'Gill Sans MT', Calibri, 'Trebuchet MS', sans-serif
'Lucida Sans', 'Lucida Sans Regular', 'Lucida Grande', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', Geneva, Verdana, sans-serif
'Trebuchet MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', 'Lucida Sans', Arial, sans-serif

entry.name: font-size
entry.desc: Indicates the desired height of glyphs from the font. For scalable fonts, the font-size is a scale factor applied to the EM unit of the font. (Note that certain glyphs may bleed outside their EM box.) For non-scalable fonts, the font-size is converted into absolute units and matched against the declared font-size of the font, using the same absolute coordinate space for both of the matched values.

entry.name: font-style
entry.desc: Allows italic or oblique faces to be selected. Italic forms are generally cursive in nature while oblique faces are typically sloped versions of the regular face.

value.name: italic
value.desc: Selects a font that is labeled as an 'italic' face, or an 'oblique' face if one is not

value.name: normal
value.desc: Selects a face that is classified as 'normal'.

value.name: oblique
value.desc: Selects a font that is labeled as an 'oblique' face, or an 'italic' face if one is not.

entry.name: font-weight
entry.desc: Specifies weight of glyphs in the font, their degree of blackness or stroke thickness.

value.desc: Thin
Extra Light (Ultra Light)
Light
Normal
Medium
Semi Bold (Demi Bold)
Bold
Extra Bold (Ultra Bold)
Black (Heavy)

value.name: bold
value.desc: Same as 700

value.name: bolder
value.desc: Specifies the weight of the face bolder than the inherited value.

value.name: lighter
value.desc: Specifies the weight of the face lighter than the inherited value.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Same as 400

entry.name: height
entry.desc: Specifies the height of the content area, padding area or border area (depending on 'box-sizing') of certain boxes.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The height depends on the values of other properties.

entry.name: justify-content
entry.desc: Aligns flex items along the main axis of the current line of the flex container.

value.name: center
value.desc: Flex items are packed toward the center of the line.

value.name: start
value.desc: The items are packed flush to each other toward the start edge of the alignment container in the main axis.

value.name: end
value.desc: The items are packed flush to each other toward the end edge of the alignment container in the main axis.

value.name: left
value.desc: The items are packed flush to each other toward the left edge of the alignment container in the main axis.

value.name: right
value.desc: The items are packed flush to each other toward the right edge of the alignment container in the main axis.

value.name: safe
value.desc: If the size of the item overflows the alignment container, the item is instead aligned as if the alignment mode were start.

value.name: unsafe
value.desc: Regardless of the relative sizes of the item and alignment container, the given alignment value is honored.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: If the combined size of the alignment subjects is less than the size of the alignment container, any auto-sized alignment subjects have their size increased equally (not proportionally), while still respecting the constraints imposed by max-height/max-width (or equivalent functionality), so that the combined size exactly fills the alignment container.

value.name: space-evenly
value.desc: The items are evenly distributed within the alignment container along the main axis.

value.name: flex-end
value.desc: Flex items are packed toward the end of the line.

value.name: flex-start
value.desc: Flex items are packed toward the start of the line.

value.name: space-around
value.desc: Flex items are evenly distributed in the line, with half-size spaces on either end.

value.name: space-between
value.desc: Flex items are evenly distributed in the line.

value.name: baseline
value.desc: Specifies participation in first-baseline alignment.

value.name: first baseline
value.desc: Specifies participation in first-baseline alignment.

value.name: last baseline
value.desc: Specifies participation in last-baseline alignment.

entry.name: left
entry.desc: Specifies how far an absolutely positioned box's left margin edge is offset to the right of the left edge of the box's 'containing block'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well

entry.name: letter-spacing
entry.desc: Specifies the minimum, maximum, and optimal spacing between grapheme clusters.

value.name: normal
value.desc: The spacing is the normal spacing for the current font. It is typically zero-length.

entry.name: line-height
entry.desc: Determines the block-progression dimension of the text content area of an inline box.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Tells user agents to set the computed value to a 'reasonable' value based on the font size of the element.

entry.name: margin
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the margin area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. Negative values for margin properties are allowed, but there may be implementation-specific limits.

entry.name: margin-bottom
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the margin area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. Negative values for margin properties are allowed, but there may be implementation-specific limits..

entry.name: margin-left
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the margin area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. Negative values for margin properties are allowed, but there may be implementation-specific limits..

entry.name: margin-right
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the margin area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. Negative values for margin properties are allowed, but there may be implementation-specific limits..

entry.name: margin-top
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the margin area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. Negative values for margin properties are allowed, but there may be implementation-specific limits..

entry.name: max-height
entry.desc: Allows authors to constrain content height to a certain range.

value.name: none
value.desc: No limit on the height of the box.

entry.name: max-width
entry.desc: Allows authors to constrain content width to a certain range.

value.name: none
value.desc: No limit on the width of the box.

entry.name: min-height
entry.desc: Allows authors to constrain content height to a certain range.

entry.name: min-width
entry.desc: Allows authors to constrain content width to a certain range.

entry.name: opacity
entry.desc: Opacity of an element's text, where 1 is opaque and 0 is entirely transparent.

entry.name: overflow
entry.desc: Shorthand for setting 'overflow-x' and 'overflow-y'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The behavior of the 'auto' value is UA-dependent, but should cause a scrolling mechanism to be provided for overflowing boxes.

value.name: hidden
value.desc: Content is clipped and no scrolling mechanism should be provided to view the content outside the clipping region.

value.name: scroll
value.desc: Content is clipped and if the user agent uses a scrolling mechanism that is visible on the screen (such as a scroll bar or a panner), that mechanism should be displayed for a box whether or not any of its content is clipped.

value.name: visible
value.desc: Content is not clipped, i.e., it may be rendered outside the content box.

entry.name: padding
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

value.name: logical
value.desc: Indicates that the values map to the logical properties instead of the physical ones.

entry.name: padding-bottom
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

entry.name: padding-left
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

entry.name: padding-right
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

entry.name: padding-top
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

value.name: absolute
value.desc: The box's position (and possibly size) is specified with the 'top', 'right', 'bottom', and 'left' properties. These properties specify offsets with respect to the box's 'containing block'.

value.name: fixed
value.desc: The box's position is calculated according to the 'absolute' model, but in addition, the box is fixed with respect to some reference. As with the 'absolute' model, the box's margins do not collapse with any other margins.

value.name: relative
value.desc: The box's position is calculated according to the normal flow (this is called the position in normal flow). Then the box is offset relative to its normal position.

value.name: static
value.desc: The box is a normal box, laid out according to the normal flow. The 'top', 'right', 'bottom', and 'left' properties do not apply.

entry.name: right
entry.desc: Specifies how far an absolutely positioned box's right margin edge is offset to the left of the right edge of the box's 'containing block'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well

entry.name: rotation
entry.desc: Rotates a block-level element counterclockwise around the point given by 'rotation-point'.

entry.name: text-align
entry.desc: Describes how inline contents of a block are horizontally aligned if the contents do not completely fill the line box.

value.name: center
value.desc: The inline contents are centered within the line box.

value.name: justify
value.desc: The text is justified according to the method specified by the 'text-justify' property.

value.name: left
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'left' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the start edge for left-to-right text.

value.name: right
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'right' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the end edge for left-to-right text.

entry.name: text-decoration-color
entry.desc: Specifies the color of text decoration (underlines overlines, and line-throughs) set on the element with text-decoration-line.

entry.name: text-decoration-line
entry.desc: Specifies what line decorations, if any, are added to the element.

value.name: line-through
value.desc: Each line of text has a line through the middle.

value.name: none
value.desc: Neither produces nor inhibits text decoration.

value.name: overline
value.desc: Each line of text has a line above it.

value.name: underline
value.desc: Each line of text is underlined.

entry.name: text-decoration-style
entry.desc: Specifies the line style for underline, line-through and overline text decoration.

value.name: dashed
value.desc: Produces a dashed line style.

value.name: dotted
value.desc: Produces a dotted line.

value.name: double
value.desc: Produces a double line.

value.name: none
value.desc: Produces no line.

value.name: solid
value.desc: Produces a solid line.

value.name: wavy
value.desc: Produces a wavy line.

entry.name: top
entry.desc: Specifies how far an absolutely positioned box's top margin edge is offset below the top edge of the box's 'containing block'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well

entry.name: transform
entry.desc: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.

value.name: matrix()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D transformation in the form of a transformation matrix of six values. matrix(a,b,c,d,e,f) is equivalent to applying the transformation matrix [a b c d e f]

value.name: matrix3d()
value.desc: Specifies a 3D transformation as a 4x4 homogeneous matrix of 16 values in column-major order.

value.name: perspective()
value.desc: Specifies a perspective projection matrix.

value.name: rotate()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D rotation by the angle specified in the parameter about the origin of the element, as defined by the transform-origin property.

value.name: rotate3d()
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise 3D rotation by the angle specified in last parameter about the [x,y,z] direction vector described by the first 3 parameters.

value.name: rotateX('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the X axis.

value.name: rotateY('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Y axis.

value.name: rotateZ('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Z axis.

value.name: scale()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D scale operation by the [sx,sy] scaling vector described by the 2 parameters. If the second parameter is not provided, it is takes a value equal to the first.

value.name: scale3d()
value.desc: Specifies a 3D scale operation by the [sx,sy,sz] scaling vector described by the 3 parameters.

value.name: scaleX()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [sx,1] scaling vector, where sx is given as the parameter.

value.name: scaleY()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [sy,1] scaling vector, where sy is given as the parameter.

value.name: scaleZ()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [1,1,sz] scaling vector, where sz is given as the parameter.

value.name: skew()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the X and Y axes. The first angle parameter specifies the skew on the X axis. The second angle parameter specifies the skew on the Y axis. If the second parameter is not given then a value of 0 is used for the Y angle (ie: no skew on the Y axis).

value.name: skewX()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the X axis by the given angle.

value.name: skewY()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the Y axis by the given angle.

value.name: translate()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D translation by the vector [tx, ty], where tx is the first translation-value parameter and ty is the optional second translation-value parameter.

value.name: translate3d()
value.desc: Specifies a 3D translation by the vector [tx,ty,tz], with tx, ty and tz being the first, second and third translation-value parameters respectively.

value.name: translateX()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the X direction.

value.name: translateY()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Y direction.

value.name: translateZ()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Z direction. Note that percentage values are not allowed in the translateZ translation-value, and if present are evaluated as 0.

entry.name: width
entry.desc: Specifies the width of the content area, padding area or border area (depending on 'box-sizing') of certain boxes.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The width depends on the values of other properties.

entry.name: z-index
entry.desc: For a positioned box, the 'z-index' property specifies the stack level of the box in the current stacking context and whether the box establishes a local stacking context.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The stack level of the generated box in the current stacking context is 0. The box does not establish a new stacking context unless it is the root element.
